00020 // Set to 0 for a release version and 1 for a beta version
00021 #define IS_BETA 1
00022 
00023 // As of November 2009, we can have alphas of a beta release or 
00024 // alphas of a stable release, typically the nightly builds. 
00025 // Most of the time we're in development, so IS_ALPHA should be defined
00026 // to 1.
00027 #define IS_ALPHA 1
00028 
00029 // Increment as appropriate every time you release a new version
00030 #define AUDACITY_VERSION   1
00031 #define AUDACITY_RELEASE   3
00032 #define AUDACITY_REVISION  12
00033 #define AUDACITY_MODLEVEL  0
00034 
00035 #if IS_ALPHA
00036    #define AUDACITY_SUFFIX wxT("-alpha-") __TDATE__ 
00037 #elif (IS_BETA)
00038    #define AUDACITY_SUFFIX    wxT("-beta") 
00039 #else
00040    #define AUDACITY_SUFFIX    wxT("") // for a stable release
00041 #endif
00042 
00043 #define AUDACITY_MAKESTR( x ) #x
00044 #define AUDACITY_QUOTE( x ) AUDACITY_MAKESTR( x )
00045 
00046 // Version string for visual display
00047 #define AUDACITY_VERSION_STRING wxT( AUDACITY_QUOTE( AUDACITY_VERSION ) ) wxT(".") \
00048                                 wxT( AUDACITY_QUOTE( AUDACITY_RELEASE ) ) wxT(".") \
00049                                 wxT( AUDACITY_QUOTE( AUDACITY_REVISION ) ) \
00050                                 AUDACITY_SUFFIX
00051 
00052 // Version string for file info (under Windows)
00053 #define AUDACITY_FILE_VERSION AUDACITY_QUOTE( AUDACITY_VERSION ) "," \
00054                               AUDACITY_QUOTE( AUDACITY_RELEASE ) "," \
00055                               AUDACITY_QUOTE( AUDACITY_REVISION ) "," \
00056                               AUDACITY_QUOTE( AUDACITY_MODLEVEL )
00057 
00058 // Increment this every time the prefs need to be reset
00059 // the first part (before the r) indicates the version the reset took place
00060 // the second part (after the r) indicates the number of times the prefs have been reset within the same version
00061 #define AUDACITY_PREFS_VERSION_STRING "1.1.1r1"
00062 
00063 // Don't change this unless the file format changes
00064 // in an irrevocable way
00065 #define AUDACITY_FILE_FORMAT_VERSION "1.3.0"
00066 
00067 class wxWindow;

00088 /* Magic for dynamic library import and export. This is unfortunately
00089  * compiler-specific because there isn't a standard way to do it. Currently it
00090  * works with the Visual Studio compiler for windows, and for GCC 4+. Anything
00091  * else gets all symbols made public, which gets messy */
00092 /* The Visual Studio implementation */
00093 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00094    #ifndef AUDACITY_DLL_API
00095       #ifdef BUILDING_AUDACITY
00096          #define AUDACITY_DLL_API _declspec(dllexport)
00097       #else
00098          #ifdef _DLL
00099             #define AUDACITY_DLL_API _declspec(dllimport)
00100          #else
00101             #define AUDACITY_DLL_API
00102          #endif
00103       #endif
00104    #endif
00105 #endif //_MSC_VER
00106 
00107 /* The GCC-elf implementation */
00108 #ifdef HAVE_VISIBILITY // this is provided by the configure script, is only
00109 // enabled for suitable GCC versions
00110 /* The incantation is a bit weird here because it uses ELF symbol stuff. If we 
00111  * make a symbol "default" it makes it visible (for import or export). Making it
00112  * "hidden" means it is invisible outside the shared object. */
00113    #ifndef AUDACITY_DLL_API
00114       #ifdef BUILDING_AUDACITY
00115          #define AUDACITY_DLL_API __attribute__((visibility("default")))
00116       #else
00117          #define AUDACITY_DLL_API __attribute__((visibility("default")))
00118       #endif
00119    #endif
00120 #endif
00121 
00122 /* The GCC-win32 implementation */
00123 // bizzarely, GCC-for-win32 supports Visual Studio style symbol visibility, so
00124 // we use that if building on Cygwin
00125 #if defined __CYGWIN__ && defined __GNUC__
00126    #ifndef AUDACITY_DLL_API
00127       #ifdef BUILDING_AUDACITY
00128          #define AUDACITY_DLL_API _declspec(dllexport)
00129       #else
00130          #ifdef _DLL
00131             #define AUDACITY_DLL_API _declspec(dllimport)
00132          #else
00133             #define AUDACITY_DLL_API
00134          #endif
00135       #endif
00136    #endif
00137 #endif
00138 
00139 // For compilers that support precompilation, includes "wx/wx.h".
00140 // Mainly for MSVC developers.
00141 //
00142 // This precompilation is only done for non-unicode debug builds.  
00143 // The rationale is that this is where there is the big time saving
00144 // because that's what you build whilst debugging.
00145 // Whilst disabling precompilation for other builds will ensure
00146 // that missing headers that would affect other platforms do get 
00147 // seen by MSVC developers too.
00148 
00149 #ifndef UNICODE
00150 #ifdef __WXDEBUG__
00151 //#include <wx/wxprec.h>
00152 #endif
00153 #endif
